chapter.title: Default Applications in the Sandbox
chapter.para: Before continuing with your Sandbox setup, take a moment to look at the default applications available to you when you sign in to the Sandbox. You can use these applications to assist your development work. The Portal itself is an application, and the Portal interface links to applications from two locations:

listitem.para: Under the My Applications list on the right side of the Portal
On the administration page accessed by clicking Admin (applicable if the user has the IT Administrator role)

chapter.para: The Portal and some of the default Sandbox applications are briefly described in the sections that follow.

section.title: Portal
section.para: Portal is the entry point to the &PRODUCTABBR; system. Here you see the available applications you are authorized to use for end-user type tasks, such as viewing and editing data in the Data Store. The set of applications, shown under My Applications on the right of Figure 3, depends on the roles assigned to the current user.

section.title: &COMPANYABBR; Dashboards
section.para: The &COMPANYABBR; Dashboard is a context-aware data reporting application. Using the &COMPANYABBR; Dashboards, you can browse to specific schools, classes, and sections to which that user has access. To open and use this application, sign in to the Sandbox environment as one of the users in your sample data set that has access to certain data in the data store. From the Portal page, click the &COMPANYABBR; Dashboards link under My Applications. Use the drop-down lists to select data associated with that user, such as the students in a given section that an educator is teaching.

section.title: &COMPANYABBR; Data Browser
section.para: The &COMPANYABBR; Data Browser is a debugging tool that users with the IT Administrator role can use to examine ingested data. To access this application when impersonating a user in the Sandbox, select the IT Administrator role when signing in. After signing in, click Admin to access the administrator page. From there, click &COMPANYABBR; Data Browser.

When you open the &COMPANYABBR; Data Browser, you're directed to a context-specific home page. The home page contains a number of HTML links you can click to traverse the Secure Data Service structure and browse the data in your tenancy.
